documentation.getting_started: Aider is a CLI-based AI pair programmer with excellent git integration. Launch Aider with the worker file as a read-only context, then ask it to implement the tasks. Aider automatically handles git commits and can work with multiple files.
tips: Use --read flag to include worker file without letting Aider edit it
Aider automatically creates git commits as you work - perfect for Czarina workflow
Use /add to add files to the chat context as needed
Use /drop to remove files from context
Aider works best with incremental tasks - tackle worker prompts step-by-step
Use --model to choose between GPT-4, Claude, etc.
The /diff command shows pending changes before committing
limitations: Requires API keys for AI models (OpenAI, Anthropic, etc.)
Best for developers comfortable with terminal workflows
